reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Enhancing the management and conservation of Elasmobranchs (sharks, skates and rays) and Billfishes through improved fisheries data collection and characterization of knowledge on harvest and trade

description.narrative: Ensure that the environment and the natural resources upon which human lives and livelihoods depend are managed in ways that sustain productivity growth, a healthy population, as well as the intrinsic spiritual and cultural value of the environment.

This award strives to ensure that the environment and the natural resources upon which human lives and livelihoods depend are managed in ways that sustain productivity growth, a healthy population, as well as the intrinsic spiritual and cultural value of the environment. More specifically, this award includes The project will use participatory and innovative approaches to data collection on the shark and billfish targeted species as well as document the social and economic aspects, particularly in the shark fin trade. The project will also work with national fish data managers to raise awareness on landings of such large pelagics as well as shark-like species. The aim is to bring the results of the interventions to national and international attention and work with government, communities and the public towards to obtain more information to make informed decisions in the long term..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/National Marine Fisheries Service/Pacific Islands Fisheries Science Center/Office for International Affairs and Seafood Inspection

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The U.S. government provides significant assistance to accelerate Ghana's transition towards an established lower middle-income country status. U.S. assistance supports Ghana's efforts to solidify its position as a leader in a region unfortunately known for civil strife, poor governance and economic stagnation. U.S. assistance to Ghana is supported through a number of presidential initiatives and foreign assistance priorities, including Feed the Future (FTF), the Global Health Initiative, and Power Africa, as well as through support from the regional Trade Africa program. To support Ghana to achieve its development goals, U.S. assistance will promote good governance; improve health care; strengthen the basic education system; expand agricultural production; increase access to power; and enhance the capacity of the Ghanaian armed forces.
